text.p: (All data above 000s except per share numbers) Note A -Revenues for both three month periods ended March 31, 1997 and 1996 were $1.5 billion. Note B -The provisions for income taxes for the three months ended March 31, 1997 and 1996 were $36.1 million and $58 million.

Note C -Primary EPS based on the weighted average number of shares outstanding for three months ended March 31, 1997 and 1996 of 66,170,000 and 67,931,000 after deduction of preferred dividends for the three months ended March 31, 1997 and 1996 of $2.6 million and $4.4 million and in 1997 the premium on redemption of preferred stock of $3.8 million.
Fully diluted earnings per share also reflects the dilutive effect of common shares contingently issuable from the exercise of stock options.

Note D -On March 27, 1996 the Life Insurance operation exchanged $429.3 million of non investment grade bond investments for a like amount of higher rated notes issued by a subsidiary of Transamerica Corp. The exchange resulted in a $7.8 million gain on investment transactions at the Life Insurance operation, which gain was eliminated in consolidition. This transaction had no effect on the consolidated financial statements of Transamerica Corp.
